awd_abstract_narration:
The ICSA 2023 China Conference: Data Science with Applications to Big Data Analysis and AI will be held in Chengdu, China, on June 30-July 3, 2023. This award is used to provide travel support to the USA participants of this conference, who will deliver invited talks or give poster presentations. This conference is the annual conference of the International Chinese Statistical Association (ICSA), which provides statisticians and data scientists with an excellent opportunity to meet, interact, network and collaborations in the research. The main goal of the conference is to promote education, research in statistics and biostatistics, and provide a forum for leading experts, junior researchers, and practitioners to discuss big data analysis, machine learning, AI, and the integration with data science. The conference also provides a unique opportunity for the exchange of statistical research activities and development of data science between different countries. The financial support to graduate students, early-career researchers, and underrepresented researchers from the USA can help them to exchange ideas about new frontiers in statistics research with numerous outstanding researchers all over the world during the conference.

The conference maintains a very strong and comprehensive program, which includes two keynote speeches, over 160 invited talk sessions, junior researcher award session, and contributed poster presentations. The conference organizers strive to enhance the diversity of speakers and maintain the high quality of presentations. Moreover, the conference features a panel discussion on "New Generation of Statisticians in Drug Development", which is about the career development for junior statisticians. For students and junior researchers, the conference will provide other great opportunities such as junior researcher awards and poster sessions. The details about the conference can be found on the website https://maths.swjtu.edu.cn/english/ICSA_2023_China_Conference.htm.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.inst_name: Georgia State University Research Foundation, Inc.
inst.org_lgl_bus_name: GEORGIA STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION INC

por.por_cntn:
We hosted  the ICSA 2023 China Conference at Chengdu, China, June 30 - July 3, 2023. It was  co-organized by the Southwest Jiaotong University, China. 

The keynote speakers were  Professor Jun Liu (Harvard University)  and  Professor Fang Yao (Peking University). Dr. Jun Liu is Professor of Statistics at Harvard University, and the recipient of the COPSS Presidents' Award in 2002.  Dr. Fang Yao is a Chair Professor in Statistics at Peking University.  More than 500 other distinguished statisticians delivered invited talks and more than  40 poster presentations were given. The NSF grant supported the travel with partial travel expenses for young researchers and PhD students in USA to attend the conference by  giving   invited talks or  poster presentations.  


The conference provided a forum for leading experts and young researchers to discuss recent progress in statistical research, and integration with data science in numerous challenging data problems. The scientific program has provided a platform for building exchanges and collaborations between researchers in statistics, biostatistics, business statistics, and data science all over the world.

Through the 2023 ICSA China conference, we have promoted the education, industry, business, and the research in statistics, biostatistics, business statistics, and data science by providing new directions of inference for complex/big data sets. The conference also provided the opportunity for the exchange of research activities between different countries, and for the development of statistical science among international organizations. The conference  invited women and minorities to chair scientific sessions. Many of the speakers (including invited young researcher and graduate students), many committee members, and session organizers are women. We also guaranteed the industry and government members in all the different committees. A Springer book based on the presentations  in the conference  is planned to  be published later.  A special issue "Nonparametric Methods in Data Science and Applications"  based on the presentations in the conference will be published in  Journal of Nonparametric Statistics. The ICSA China Conference  provided the training of biostatistics  for graduate students and young researchers. There is a panel session entitled "New Generation of Statisticians in Drug Development".  We also organized  the special  session "Junior Researcher Award Session" in the conference. 


Last Modified: 09/01/2024
Modified by: Yichuan Zhao
